title: Beautiful, thin didone font
author: dead.sound

comments.content:
Appears to be an old Image Club Graphics typeface called Andrich Minerva, but I can’t find a current source for it:  
 [http://www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Image-Club-G...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317192716/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Image-Club-Graphics%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Andrich%20Minerva%20-%20Regular&fstyle=&fsize=60&fid=63e7b36a8e9b624045c8de12a3508089&wrap=2&text=bespoke%20%26%20co "http://www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Image-Club-Graphics%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Andrich%20Minerva%20-%20Regular&fstyle=&fsize=60&fid=63e7b36a8e9b624045c8de12a3508089&wrap=2&text=bespoke%20%26%20co")

ITC Century Light is very similar:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/century/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317192716/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/century/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/century/")

So is Chronicle Display Extra Light (though it’s ampersand is a bit more ornate):  
 [http://www.typography.com/fonts/chronicle-text/styles/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317192716/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/chronicle-text/styles/ "http://www.typography.com/fonts/chronicle-text/styles/")
Hi. Definitely Andrich Minerva. Spot on! Cheers mate.
